definition: to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
surname Lian
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Western officials seem glumly reconciled to another term for Mr Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 西方官員似乎對卡爾扎伊的連任感到悶悶不樂。

sentences.english: Mr Tien pledged his party's support for Mr Tung for a second term.
sentences.chinese: 田北俊聲明自由黨支持董建華連任。

sentences.english: The verdict throws more uncertainty into the Republican rocky re-election bid.
sentences.chinese: 這個裁定給共和黨的連任選舉增加了更多的不確定性。

sentences.english: That would be as big a setback as his rigged re-election in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 這一退步將跟他2009年依靠弊選連任一樣糟糕。

sentences.english: The chairman serves for four years and can be reappointed.
sentences.chinese: 董事會主席任期四年，可以連任。

sentences.english: Chen Zhonghe, mostly favored, was elected out unexpectedly and lost the election for another term.
sentences.chinese: 呼聲最高的陳忠和意外落選，失去了連任的機會。

sentences.english: China was re-elected as a member of the Governing Council.
sentences.chinese: 中國連任“電聯”理事會成員。

sentences.english: He was one of the founders of the Jiazi Society of Calligraphy in 1985 and has been its president since then.
sentences.chinese: 一九八五年籌組甲子書學會，並連任會長至今。

sentences.english: His refusal to seek a third presidential term cemented that.
sentences.chinese: 他拒絕參選連任第三任總統使這一點得到牢固確立。

sentences.english: Constitution of Egypt, the President had 6 years of a term can be re-elected.
sentences.chinese: 此前埃及憲法規定總統每屆任期6年，可連選連任。

sentences.english: Ban said earlier this month that he wanted a second term.
sentences.chinese: 在本月初，潘基文表示連任意願。

sentences.english: He announced Monday he wouldn't seek re-election in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 他在週一宣佈不會謀求在2012年獲得連任。

sentences.english: The Nigerian constitution currently limits presidents to two four-year terms.
sentences.chinese: 尼日利亞現行憲法限制總統兩次連任四年的任期。

sentences.english: Ortega's left-wing Sandinista party found that the law barring consecutive terms was invalid.
sentences.chinese: 他們發現，組織奧爾特加競選按連任的法律已經失效。

sentences.english: And he made sure the country held its next presidential election as planned in eighteen sixty-four, when he was re-elected.
Mr Sarkozy hopes to be returned to the Elysee Palace for a second term next spring.
sentences.chinese: 薩科奇希望明年春天在大選中成功連任。

definition: to be elected/to be selected
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to elect/election/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
to hold power/in office
Parliament (UK)/Congress (US)/Diet (Japan)/Legislative Yuan (Taiwan)
to take part in an election/to run for office
party chief
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
president (of a country)/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2],屆|届[jie4]
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
ruling class/leaders (of society)/oligarchy
candidate/CL:名[ming2]
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
ruling party/the party in power
